author: mloho
body:
```powershell
$ht = @{}
$ht.$null = 'Irretrievable'
```
```
> $ht

Name                           Value
----                           -----
                               Irretrievable

> $ht.$null
Key cannot be null.
Parameter name: key
At line:1 char:1
+ $ht.$null
+ ~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : OperationStopped: (:) [], ArgumentNullException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.ArgumentNullException

> $ht.Remove($null)
Exception calling "Remove" with "1" argument(s): "Key cannot be null.
Parameter name: key"
At line:1 char:1
+ $ht.Remove($null)
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [], MethodInvocationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : ArgumentNullException

```

Design choice? :)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
In this case:

```powershell
$ht.$null = 'foo'
```

Actually creates an entry where the key is an empty string, not `$null` as you'd expect:

```powershell
$ht.""
foo
```

I think this is `by design`.  `$null` is being converted to an empty string since a [string] value type can't be $null.

```powershell
[string]$a = $null
$a -eq $null
false
$a -eq ""
true
```

title: [Hashtable] Null key = Irretrievable value
